New Records: Jos Buttler and Alex Hales produced the highest opening partnership of 170 runs in a T20 World Cup semi-final.
Alex Hales scored 86 not out, the highest score by an England player in a T20 World Cup semi-final.
Key Match Events: England won the match by 10 wickets with 24 balls to spare.
Hardik Pandya hit a rapid 63 off 33 balls, including five sixes, before being dismissed in a hit-wicket incident.
Virat Kohli was caught by Adil Rashid off Chris Jordan's yorker, a crucial moment in the match.
Pre-Game Insights: England won the toss and decided to bowl, with Chris Jordan opening the innings.
The match was played at the Adelaide Oval, and the weather forecast was discussed, with a reserve day mentioned.
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler and Alex Hales were praised for their outstanding performances.
Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli provided post-match comments criticizing India's performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match set up a final against Pakistan, with historical comparisons made to previous India vs Pakistan finals.
